alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 10:42PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Custer County through 1145 PM CDT... At 1042 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oconto, or 14 miles south of Broken Bow, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Broken Bow, Callaway, Ansley, Mason City, Oconto, Berwyn, Weissert, Westerville, Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Burr Oak, Gavin Siding, Lodi, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road, Buckeye, Block Hill Basin, Pressey State Wildlife Management Area and Cumro. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 73 and 104. Highway 2 between mile markers 275 and 307. Highway 92 between mile markers 300 and 308. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central Nebraska.
